definition.name: NXapm_ranging
definition.doc:
Base class for the configuration and results of ranging definitions.
Ranging is a data post-processing step used in the research field of atom probe during which elemental, isotopic, and/or molecular identities are assigned to mass-to-charge-state ratios within certain intervals. The documentation of these steps is based on ideas that have been described in the literature:
* `M. K. Miller <https://doi.org/10.1002/sia.1719>`_ * `D. Haley et al. <https://doi.org/10.1017/S1431927620024290>`_ * `M. Kühbach et al. <https://doi.org/10.1017/S1431927621012241>`_

field.name: min_mass_to_charge
field.doc:
Smallest :math:`{\frac{m}{q}}_{min}` mass-to-charge-state ratio value.
The lower (left-hand side) inclusive bound of the interval :math:`[{\frac{m}{q}}_{min}`, {\frac{m}{q}}_{max}]`.

field.name: max_mass_to_charge
field.doc:
Largest :math:`{\frac{m}{q}}_{max}` mass-to-charge-state ratio value.
The upper (right-hand side) inclusive bound of the interval :math:`[{\frac{m}{q}}_{min}`, {\frac{m}{q}}_{max}]`.

field.name: n_mass_to_charge
field.doc: The number of bins on the interval :math:`[{\frac{m}{q}}_{min}`, {\frac{m}{q}}_{max}]`.

group.name: mass_spectrum
group.doc: A default histogram aka mass spectrum of the mass-to-charge-state ratio values.

group.name: background_quantification
group.doc: Details of the background model that was used to correct the total counts per bin into counts.

field.name: description
field.doc:
Free-text field to describe how atom probers define a background model.
Thereby, community feedback can be collected to inform an improved version of this base class in the future.

group.name: peak_search_and_deconvolution
group.doc: How were peaks in the mass-to-charge-state ratio histogram identified.

group.name: peak_identification
group.doc: Details about how peaks, with taking into account error models, were interpreted as ion types or not.

field.name: number_of_ion_types
field.doc:
How many ion types are distinguished. If no ranging was performed, each ion is of the special unknown type. The iontype ID of this unknown type is 0 representing a reserved value.
Consequently, start counting iontypes from 1.

field.name: maximum_number_of_atoms_per_molecular_ion
field.doc: Assumed maximum value that suffices to store all relevant molecular ions, even the most complicated ones that one can typically observe and distinguish typically. Currently, a value of 32 is used (see M. Kühbach et al. <https://doi.org/10.1017/S1431927621012241>`_).
